boardgame.name: Justice Denied
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for Cepheus Engine

Logan Murphy was a ruthless dictator on the world of Casudxe for nearly a decade before abdicating power. Now the Prime Minister of that world wants him brought to justice. He was recently sighted on a water world in the Sonora sector. Capturing him there should be a piece of cake!

boardgame.name: Soul Seller
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unified Legal Company

The ULC is the largest justice system in the sector. They provide everything from courtrooms to prisons and bounty hunters. Anyone looking for a cash quick can tune their ship system to Huntr™ to get a bountyhead in their system.
The first in a monthly installment of pamphlets for MOTHERSHIP sci-fi horror RPG. Issue 1 is soul seller, a list of people corporations have put out a bounty for.

Inside you will find

3 Bountyheads
Their Crimes
Where to find them
1d5 People who saw them last
1d10 Places they were last seen at.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Volume 3 (Black Hack)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

13 new monsters with an OSR feel for your Black Hack game. I modeled the stat blocks after TBH 2e, but all these monsters should be quite compatible with TBH 1e as well.
In addition to the usual STATS, each monster has extensive FLUFF including Description, Tactics, Lore, Ecology and Seeds (adventure ideas).

boardgame.name: Depths of Courage: The Raid on Alexandria, December 19, 1941
boardgame.description:
Depths of Courage volume 9 is a solitaire game on the Italian mini-sub attack on Alexandria Harbor. The active player takes on the role of the commanders of the three, two-man crew S.L.C. (Siluro Lenta Corsa) Maiale (Pig) class mini-submarines. You must endeavor to overcome the Allied defenses and night-time visibility to inflict as much damage as possible before being killed, captured or escaping.

Each copy of Depths of Courage volume 9 is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 point-to-point map
20 double sided, un-mounted counters
6 pages of rules with designer notes and bibliography

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards (a custom card set for the entire series of games is available) and six sided die to play the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Depths of Courage vol. 9: Raid on Alexandria.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $7.00.
A custom card set, that can be used with this game as well as all of the others in the Italian Frogmen Depths of Courage Series, is also available for an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Soulblight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven sundered, struck deep down into the darkest depths of the earth.

Corruption festering forth from the caverns and gulches that have become their tomb, drawing the blackened hearts of monsters and men alike, to worship at their corpses. Blasphemous influence roused the sleepers, and from it sprang the Soulblight, that ravaged the kingdom above, warping the innocents’ body and mind ‘til they are as one of the Accursed.

Then one day, a Three-Eyed Witch arrived at the court of King Jedovid in smoke and a shower of light and she pointed a crooked finger at his face and cackled this oracle:

“Seven sleepers dream nightmares for the living, and though they are wreathed not in gold or jewels, each alone is a sovereign far greater than you. But the plight they bring shall be your cure as well. Though dead they lie, their hearts still beat and their blood remains potent. In the blood, you’ll find your cure.
Seek their tombs in the Shadowdark, deep below, and you may yet save your tarnished land.”

Soulblight is a third-party setting compatible with The Arcane Library's Shadowdark RPG: A sword-and-sorcery style world set in the deserts, jungles and mountainous heights of the kingdom of Lothorian.

Delve into the sunken depths of the Shadowdark, as an ancient darkness awakens the slumbering Sovereign, catalysts of the terrible Soulblight that now ravages the kingdom and its people.

This Setting Guide provides you with the following contents:

Seven Regions, Seven Shadowdarks, Seven Sovereign: seven exciting regions of Lothorian, from the grand, colourful throne-city of Cathedra to the distant Blue Glades, where the chariot herd of the giants roams past hills and towering crystal monoliths.
The Soulblight: sin made manifest, a cursed affliction that warps the minds and bodies of whomever it touches - even the heroes. Will they resist the urge? Or succumb to the lure of power the affliction provides...?
New Classes for the Shadowdark RPG: the Red Monk and the Occultist!
New Monsters: Over 100+ new monsters to threaten and torment the world of Lothorian.
Survival of the Fittest! Optional Rules for Diseases and Thirst to bring the harshness of the desert to your Shadowdark table.
Did we mention the Loot? New, wonderful, terrifying, cursed, gilded, valuable and potentially lethal magic items, forbidden hexes and sanguine rites for adventures to line their pockets with.
And more hidden secrets...

boardgame.name: London Necropolis Railway
boardgame.description:
London, 1849: The cholera epidemic of the last two years has overrun the city's ability to inter the dead. A new cemetery must be built to handle the needs of London for the indefinite future, outside of the city limits - far enough away that growth won't be an issue. The only way to transport the deceased and their loved ones to the cemetery is by train. This new system needs to be designed and you and your fellow planners have been tasked with submitting proposals. The most successful design will be awarded the contract by the city and your name will be listed among the great planners of history.

Each turn in London Necropolis Railway, you choose a card and take the two associated action discs. You then activate 1-3 of the actions on the card, spending the discs of the matching colors, to improve your London Terminus, the Brookwood Necropolis, and/or the Railway that connects the two. You need to manage your money, your staff, and make sure you can keep pace with your improvements in each section. In addition, you can spend action discs to improve the prestige of your system, in order to gain more points for your London improvements.

Points come primarily from two areas: how prestigious you’ve made the London Terminus and how well you've filled the Necropolis. After twelve rounds, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Meister der Illusion Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

The cult of blood rages in the Totenstadt. As if zombies and mutants weren't enough, you now also have to deal with blood horrors, suicides and insane blood rituals!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Der Kult des Blutes wüttet in der Totenstadt.
Als würden Zombies und Mutanten nicht schon genug sein bekommt ihr es jetzt auch nocht mit Blutschrecken, Selbstmördern und irren Blutritualen zu tun!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

boardgame.name: Totenstadt: Infizierter Glaube Booster
boardgame.description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Father Harry calls for church service in the Totenstadt. Disciples and acolytes prepare for baptism, and a priest needs your help to save his flock from Father Harry and his evil minions.

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters


Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!Pater Harry ruft zum Gottesdienst in der Totenstadt.
Jünger und Messdiener bereiten sich auf die Taufe vor und ein Pater braucht eure Hilfe um seine Schäfchen zu retten.

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Miniatures Series 2
boardgame.description:
Bring your game to life with this miniatures pack, containing each of the Final Girl Series 2 final girls and each of the killers. Miniatures are all in one box and are not offered separately.

This upgrade is not required for gameplay.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Storage Box Series 1
boardgame.description:
We've created a nice big box for each Series of Final Girl that will keep everything in one place. Each box includes additional interior boxes for organizational purposes. The Core Box and Feature Films fit in vertically with the beautiful spine art facing out. Next to those will be space for the Core Box, a "Cast and Crew" box (included with the Storage Box!) that can be used to hold that Season's Girl miniatures and the vignette film, and an additional "catch all" box (included with the Storage Box!) for additional storage of things like the Lore and Scenario book, Gruesome Death Books, and other stretch goal or add-on items. The game mat box (included with the Storage Box) will feature a "VCR-like" design for aesthetics.

Cast and Crew Box
Let's face it, the girl miniatures need more space rather than being stored in the core box! So each storage box will include a Cast and Crew box and insert that will hold the Girl Miniatures for that Series. In addition, there will be room for that Season's Vignette Film.

Killer, supporting, and vehicle miniatures all get stored with their associated Feature Film!

Note: Cast & Crew box does NOT come with the miniatures or the vignette.

Bonus Features Box
The Bonus Features box will hold those items that don't have a great place otherwise, like the Lore and Scenario books and the Gruesome Death books.

boardgame.name: Trading Post
boardgame.description:
2-6 traders will explore new lands, trade many resources, and experience conflict all while trying to build the greatest trading post! Players try to acquire Land cards, Building cards, and End Game bonuses. to achieve the most victory points and win.

On your turn, roll dice to win land that they have explored, gain resources, trade resources and action/conflict cards, and build blueprints into buildings. At any time during the round they can purchase action or conflict cards.

A backstory for each killer in Series 1
A backstory for each Final Girl in Series 1
Tips on playing each Final Girl in Series 1
A scenario for each killer/location combination in Series 1, with special rules and setup instructions for each scenario

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Gruesome Deaths Books Series 1
boardgame.description:
You hold in your hand a book of Gruesome Deaths for use with locations in Final Girl. Inside, you will find horrible and terrifying descriptions of death at the hands of the Final Girl lineup of killers. This experience is totally optional but is a fun way to spice up the story as you play a game of Final Girl!

These booklets are labeled "Rated R: Vulgar Language and Extreme Violence. It is intended for Mature Audiences Ages 18+".

The Series 1 books were originally released as PDFs during fulfillment of the Final Girl Series 1 Kickstarter, with one booklet per Final Girl location. They will be released in a physical format as part of the Final Girl Series 2 Kickstarter.

The working title of these booklets was the "Gruesome Death Matrix" but it was changed before release.

boardgame.name: in*die zine (Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

card / board / cutout

It's fun to play with paper, so we're taking pen-and-paper games back to basics! Grab some paper, some card, a gluestick or two, a big pair of sharp scissors, and get playing!

All proceeds go directly to the creators of this zine, and your support is a vote in support of the indie TTRPG scene!

Here's what you can find in this issue:

The Games We Play, a solo journaling roleplaying game using Tarot cards, about risking everything to get a single, almighty Wish
HyperHalfling's Lists #6, a random tables to help you build a convincing story out of an old business card
Family Value, a way to score and rank your family members and display your loved ones around your home and place of work
Games On (Business Card), a set of template business cards with quirky and memorable ideas on both sides
Die20!: Pink Floyd's "The Wall" (for TRPGs), a look at "the coward's cardboard", that staple of games, the Gamemaster's Screen
Instant Miniature!, crafty fun for all ages, and a super quick way to replace the miniatures you forgot to bring to tonight's game
Orizuru: a half-formed thing, a solo origami / journaling game about transforming into a beautiful bird
Motel 13, a solo journaling game using a deck of cards and exploring an edge-of-town motel and its guests
Exquisite Oracle, a collaborative worldbuilding game using a beautiful custom oracle deck that you can cut out and keep
Hoodwinked for Good: a Satire, a game about stealing from the rich and giving to the poor, where your targets are drawn at random from a bowl
All the World's a Card Game, a card-based worldbuilding supplement exploring how societies and worlds change over time
Crocheted Adventurers Do a Dungeon Crawl, in which our favourite yarn-based heroes explore a dungeon made seemingly of cardboard

boardgame.name: Skyline Express: Luggage tokens
boardgame.description: 120 screen printed wooden luggage tokens to replace the standard luggage cubes in the Bags and Belongings expansion. This add-on was available in the campaign pledge manager for Skyline Express.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Skyline Express: Bags & Belongings

boardgame.name: Quiz Kids
Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land
boardgame.description:
Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land is an educational and entertaining family game. It encourages children's desire to improve their mental ability. The aim is to help children develop their skills in logic and recall. Most children will easily handle 50% of the questions, within their age level. However, since the game is won by the roll of the dice, all players have an equal chance of winning. The player who gets to the end of the track first, wins.

Players roll the dice to determine the number of spaces they will move on the board if they answer their question correctly; the questions are colour-coded into three levels of difficulty according to age.

Includes a plush die, five plush playing pieces, and a cloth game board (all washable) as well as a set of question cards.

boardgame.name: Gateway to the Frozen Wastes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #6 of Populated Hexes Monthly covers the town of Ogrim, a lonely outpost at the edge of the Deep Ocean, and last outpost before the Frozen Wastes. Includes a map of Ogrim, notable NPCs, adventure hooks, and rules for adding templates to character classes in your OSR game.

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Terror from the Grave
boardgame.description:
Final Girl Vignette

Some of you've dealt with the birds, now what will you do with the Zombies. Find out in this all-new Vignette Film box that can be played in combination with ANY location! Zombies in Space anyone? Zombies in the Arctic? No, not the poor people of Maple Lane, haven't they been through enough?!?!?!

The Vignette requires both the Core Box and one of the Feature Film Boxes to play the game. The Vignette provides the unique Killer and one Final Girl, and the Feature Film Box provides the Location.

boardgame.description: This is a set of official acrylic promo tokens for Shaper
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Android: Netrunner

boardgame.name: Bestia
boardgame.description:
Bestia is an Italian card game. It is a gambling game and is similar to Briscola and Tressette. The word bestia means beast.

The game of the Beast was invented in France in the eighteenth century. It is described in the book "Académie Universelle des Jeux" - Paris 1739,[1] which is available online, at pages. 255 et seq. The first mention of Bestia comes from Italian Raffaele Bisteghi, in his play "The practical", Bologna 1753. The eighteenth century version was somewhat different from today's version.

-- from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bestia_(game)

This is a free online implementation. If you don't want to register, click on "Gioca come ospite"

boardgame.name: Viceroy: Times of Darkness Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A pack of 10 cards for the 3 modules of the Viceroy: Tides of Darkness Expansion.

There are cards for each of the modules.

Aristocrats Module - 1 Law card
Life Peerage: At end of the game: Copy the lower-section reward of any Aristocrats character in an opponent's pyramid.

Invasion Module - 6 Monsters, 1 Law card

2 Tier I Monsters: Dragon Kin, Quetzalcoatl
2 Tier II Monsters: Crystal Golem, Hellrider
2 Tier III Monsters: Djinn, Ogre


Military Exercise: Each player may immediately combat current monsters. Player's don't get penalty cards in this combat. Don't discard monsters after this combat.

Underworld Module - 1 Law Card
Indulgence: At end of the game: Discard any number of your Bribe Tokens by paying 3 Gemstones for each.

There is also one Character card that can be used with all three modules.
Mistress: 2 Power Points for each token on your combat card.

boardgame.name: Director Tecnico Pasion total!
boardgame.description:
The game takes place on a tabletop that represents a soccer stadium. The role of each participant is that of Soccer Technical Director and owner of a soccer team. The strategy is applied to the technical direction of the team and a good administration of the franchise to win as many encounters as possible. The more games you win, the more wealth you will be able to generate for your team.

Each season, your team obtains income that will allow you to have sufficient resources to achieve the purchase of the biggest stadium and the players that score the most goals and earn the most profits. Good administration is key because you have to cover the costs and fines to which your Team may be credited. If you run out of resources, you will be disqualified from the tournament.

The challenge is to achieve an optimal balance between sports and administrative decisions to meet the objective of the game and show your opponents that you are the best Soccer Technical Director!



JUEGO DE FUTBOL ESTRATÉGICO Director Técnico DTEl juego se desarrolla en un tablero de mesa que representa un Estadio de FUTBOL. El rol de cada participante es el de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT y Dueño de un Equipo de FUTBOL. La estrategia se aplica a la dirección técnica del Equipo y a una buena administración de la franquicia para ganar la mayor cantidad posible de Encuentros. Mientras más partidos ganes, lograrás generar mayor riqueza económica para tu Equipo.

En cada Temporada, tu Equipo obtiene ingresos por diferentes conceptos que te permitirán contar con recursos suficientes para lograr la compra del Estadio de mayor capacidad de espectadores y al Equipo que cuenta con los jugadores que te darán mayor puntuación por cada gol anotado y, a su vez, mayores ganancias. Una buena administración es clave porque deberás cubrir los costos que representan las multas a las que pueda hacerse acreedor tu Equipo, ya que si te quedas sin recursos, serás descalificado del torneo.

El reto está en lograr un balance óptimo entre las decisiones deportivas y las administrativas para cumplir con el objetivo del juego y demostrar a tus contrincantes, ¡que tú eres el mejor Director Técnico del Fútbol. Poner en práctica tus habilidades estratégicas COMO DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT para ganar la mayor cantidad de Encuentros, generando riqueza económica para comprar la franquicia DEL MUNDO y el Estadio DE LAS ESTRELLAS. Los dos activos más cotizados y rentables del kit de DIRECTOR TÉCNICO DT.

boardgame.name: Et in Arcadia Ego
boardgame.description:
User summary of Introduction
Et in Arcadia Ego concerns the dreams, fears, and nightmares of a gay scholar dying of AIDS in the early 1990s, at the height of the AIDS epidemic.
The player characters are among the scholar's few friends and associates that remain in contact with him. He has invited them to visit him at Arcadie,for a final visit. But before he dies, he intends to bring his friends briefly into his dreams, so that together they might relive pleasant moments from their past. Of course, the pleasant remembrances bleed into increasingly dangerous nightmares as he nears death.

boardgame.name: Urlaubsspiel
boardgame.description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home in the upper left corner of the game sheet. The first to reach the travel agency in the center of the game sheet wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Die ARAG in Europa
boardgame.description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach the ARAG building in Düsseldorf wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Game board may be paper or very light, foldable, card stock.

It's the ARAG-Zentrale from the 1960s (Architect: Paul Schneider-Esleben)

boardgame.name: Das große HÖRZU-Verkehrsspiel
boardgame.description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home at the lower left corner of the game map. The first to reach the finish at the upper left corner wins the game. On the paces with traffic signs traffic situations hinder or benefit the players.

Originally publised in HÖR ZU magazine.

boardgame.name: Das lustige Würfelspiel: Hol' das Brot vom Bäcker
boardgame.description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space 17, the bakery, wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Likely a 1970s or 1980s publication.

boardgame.name: Bärenmarke Almenspiel
boardgame.description: Typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

boardgame.name: Das fröhliche Ferienspiel
boardgame.description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". On some spaces events cause the players to gain or lose points. Sometimes event cards are drawn. Some of the rules of the game are integrated in the game board. The player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Vom Korn zum Brotgenuss
boardgame.description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Multi
boardgame.description:
Multi is a simple family card game with the aim of teaching children multiplication.

The game has a number of cards with numbers from 1 to 12 which are factors and more cards with numbers up to 144 which are results. During the game, players have a combination of these in their hand.

On your turn, you may play a result card if there are two factor cards on the table which make up the correct result for your result card and collect all the cards to your score pile. If you can't do this, you have to play a new factor card to the table. After playing, a player's hand is refilled.

The game ends when the draw deck is exhausted. The payer with the most sets, wins.

There is no publication year stated but the packaging suggests 1940s or 1950s.

boardgame.name: Bärenstark
boardgame.description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The trip takes place in East Germany and the game was created by the German Communist Party.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

boardgame.name: Die Gewürzlandreise
boardgame.description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 76 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Drones VS Goélands
boardgame.description:
Drones VS Goélands ("Drones VS Seagulls") is a fast-paced line control game where you will try to achieve combos.

The game is played in two winning rounds.

Both sides take turns placing cards of varying strength on the various bases. Overcoming the opponent's force controlling the opponent's base allows to conquer it, resulting in a specific bonus effect, which may allow the conquest of other bases, again with bonus effects!

The objective is to control 7 bases simultaneously (immediate victory) or to control the majority at the end of the round, triggered when one of the players has exhausted his hand. If a player controls all 7 bases simultaneously, he wins the round immediately. As soon as a player has won 2 rounds, he is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Bloody Retribution: The Battle of Inkerman
boardgame.description:
This is a two-player grand-tactical simulation – easily adapted for solitaire play – of the largest Russian offensive of the Crimean War. Even so, both players have the necessity of both attacking and defending. It uses the alternating-actions system introduced here in issue no. 93’s Wagram and issue no. 98 Alma games.

The emphasis is on players’ mastery of overall operations rather than the minutiae of tactics. In effect, they role-play the supreme commanders, not the whole chain of command as is common in most complex tactical-level games. It’s a mechanically simpler approach that is at the same time more realistic, given the fact no individual in such situations would have the timely knowledge needed to make detailed decisions.

The battle was personally ordered by the Czar as a final attempt to break the Allied siege lines along Sevastopol’s southern perimeter. The British were initially caught by surprise along the steep slopes of Mount Inkerman. Both sides threw in everything they had available, hoping for a decisive victory. That made for a fierce day of back and forth combat characterized by soldier-level heroism and high-command incompetence. In the end the Russians retreated, but it was a near-run thing that could’ve gone either way.

Each hexagon on the map represents 200 yards (183 meters) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver are brigades, regiments and battalions. Each full turn represents one or two hours of real time. The first two turns were dominated by dense fog across the whole battlefield; therefore they each represent two hours to take into the account the inescapably slower tempo of operations under such conditions. Artillery is represented abstractly via bombardment markers. There is one full sheet of 228 medium-size (5/8”) iconic counters. Playing time is about three hours, and complexity is low-intermediate.

Published in Paper Wars issue 100

- Description from the Publisher

boardgame.name: Fantasy Commander
boardgame.description:
Fantasy Commander is a strategic board game with highly detailed resin miniatures at a scale of 1:72 (20mm) by Signum Games. Take part in an epic showdown in the Signum world, where the glorified heroes bring their armies of fantasy creatures to the battlefield and unleash a real war out there.

Although the game is basically designed as a two-player duel game, you can involve even more players in additional game modes, as well as test yourself in a single-player Narrative Campaign, where you can easily master basic game rules.

boardgame.name: Our Lord of Warmth
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Having succumbed to madness, the northern farming folk of Thulud seem to have melded into one hive mind now bent on the construction of their new manifestation, huddled together and bursting from the wooden ribs of the colossus known only as Our Lord of Warmth.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: In an Instant
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In an Instant is a game about photographing the end of the world. Explore the last moments of humanity. Mourn the Earth. Remind the world what you've lost.

At the end of everything, what's worth remembering?

boardgame.name: Isbjörn
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A huge polar bear died in the forest. Brave villagers investigated and never returned. How did the bear get into the forest and where did the people disappear to? Climb into the deepest bowels of a giant bear and find out.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: Producer: Choose Your Star
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Become the manager of a series of girls in their pursuit of fame in their various fields.

boardgame.name: Mixed Pickles
boardgame.description:
A dexterity party game from the late 19th century comprising sets of wonderful, polished wooden misshapes (the pickles) and a rack's-worth of pointed, wooden handled 'lifting spikes'(!).

Each player receives set of the pickle pieces and two spikes; starting with the Turnip piece, they try and lift the piece into the 'jar' - if they stand up OR drop the piece their turn is over. The first player to drop the turnip in chooses the next piece, all others set their turnips aside for end game penalty scoring.

The rules mention an extra rule for 'Tittups' - pieces that don't seem to exist in any edition this reporter has seen (and I've seen three different editions, one of which removes all mention of Tittups altogether).

Different editions presented in cylindrical, square and octagonal bottles have been confirmed.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #14 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical items like the crown of radiance, bolstering battleaxe, cyclops monocle, and rod of the monkey king!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like final witness, cage of sacred silver, unfortunate origami, and avenge me!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new hex hunter, way of balance, and jinxed sorcerer!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the clever calligraphy wyrm, the transcendent spirit of abandon, and the sinister Krampus!

boardgame.name: Eyes Beyond the Torchlight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eyes Beyond the Torchlight, a roleplaying game of fantastic adventures. Powered by the innovative Target 12 Game System with its single roll attack and damage mechanic. Eyes Beyond the Torchlight is a simple, intuitive, player-facing game perfect for new, or old, GMs and Players. Contains 4 standard character archetypes that are customized by various Edges and Hindrances. 7 classic character ancestries, from Dwarf to Human. Over 175 Monsters... Treasures... and More!

boardgame.name: The Lost Tomb
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A short, dungeoncrawl adventure for the Eyes Beyond the Torchlight game. Includes optional rules for escalating damage and torches/lanterns.

boardgame.name: Soothsayer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A setting guide for the Eyes Beyond the Torchlight roleplaying game.

Welcome to the lands of the soothsayer, it is now yours. Included in this book is a barebones setting with just a framework for you to complete. The basics are all here, from religions and languages, to the great city of Woldspire, to the swamps and plains where men fear to tread. Take what is here, change the things you want to change, keep the things you want to keep, and make it your own for you and your table.

Also contains several optional rules, including mob rules, coin weights, death saves, and expanded ancestries.

boardgame.name: The Bounty Hunter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Prestige Class for 5E from the Realm Scribe!

The Bounty Hunter is a mix of the Ranger and Rogue classes and focuses on tracking and killing large threats. It can deal high amounts of damage to an enemy that it has marked as its quarry, tracks them with supernatural precision, and then when they take down a target they get a new resouce; a bounty, which can be used to replace a d20 roll with a flat number.

This class is for high-level campaigns that allow for multi-classing in order for a character to meet the requirements for this Prestige Class. It is designed to fuse together the idea of a wise ranger with a cut-throat rogue, and requires high dexterity and above average intelligence and wisdom, levels in both the ranger and rogue classes, and to be at least 10th level before taking a level in this class. Prestige Classes are very powerful and meant for high threat campaigns.

boardgame.name: Demonsbane: The Rod of Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Demonsbane is a hexcrawl for Cairn, set in a strange, fantastical realm where Fungal Folk and Mineral Shambler giants and Rat Folk move about. Includes nnumerous site/dungeon maps, treasure and some NPC illustrations. There are some portals, shards that need collected to once again banish Xoxyl the Former-Wizard Lich. His dragon is trying to break into the world from a sky portal to free him.

There is town to seek some rest. There are minor treasures, plant life to collect, weather table, a fairly long bestiary. There is much pink.

This would make for a good few sessions if your party gets transported to another dimension via portal or some other nefarious magics.

boardgame.name: OSR Class: Martial Artist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Martial Artist class covers specialists in relatively realistic unarmed combat (as in opposition to classes that simulate fantasy unarmed combat) for OSR games.

An experienced GM can use this document to convert the class to any OSR system of their preference. However, the class was designed with the medieval-authentic system of Lion & Dragon and the setting of Dark Albion in mind.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Halls of Jarl Sigurd
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Haunted Halls of Jarl Sigurd describe three northman-inspired classes for OSR games: the Hirdman (fighter), the Sea Raider (barbarian), and the Thurl (magic-user).

An experienced GM can use this document to convert the class to any OSR system of their preference. However, the class was designed with the medieval-authentic system of Lion & Dragon and the setting of Dark Albion in mind.

boardgame.name: The Endless Cold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hogstad is a small village in the very north of the known world. For miles and miles around there exists nothing but pine forests, permafrost arid lands and snowy mountain ranges with glaciers occupying their tops. It is a place where families of fishers and hunters live, people who have learned to make the best of the tough terrain.

Now, though, it all is about to change, as a blizzard hits fiercely upon the settlement and does not seem to retreat as days pass.

About the Adventure

The Endless Cold is an adventure for 4-6 level 3 characters and is inspired by the strategy game Frostpunk. It is not the typical 5e adventure. It plays out in a span of many days, where on some days, random events will happen in between other scripted events. The decision making of the party during these events will affect the lives of the locals in many ways, as in The Endless Cold actions bring real consequences. Furthermore, there is a morale system in the adventure, and depending on the outcome of these events, it can drop or rise, bringing in more outcomes.

boardgame.name: The Fields of Normandy: A Solitaire Wargame
boardgame.description:
"The Fields of Normandy: A Solitaire Wargame" is an accessible, portable, solitaire "hex and counter" style wargame in a book. Instructions and colour game maps are included; the player just needs to bring a pencil, 2 standard six-sided dice and an eraser. Nothing else is needed to play.
The player's task is to order rifle squads, machine gun teams, mortar teams and PIAT teams across the map to achieve the objectives, countering any enemy threat which is found along the way. The game rules reveal, position and attack with enemy units whilst you focus on your objectives.
There are 15 missions across varied maps with random enemies providing plenty of re-playability as the Allied push into Normandy in World War II is re-created.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cookie Crash
boardgame.description:
Cookie Crash you play simultaneously and must recognize color and shape as quickly as possible. In the middle of the table there are drums containing different types of cookies. If you manage to place the correct cookies next to the drum as quickly as possible, you claim the drum.

Each player receives the same number of cookie cards. These are placed under the cookie drum. If cookies do not fit, they go to the discard pile. Each player also has a rolling pin to crush the other player's cookies, a lid to close a drum and a joker cookie to fit each cookie. To win, you must collect as many cookie drum cards as possible. The player with the most cookies in all the drums is the winner.

To make the game a little more difficult, there are 2 upgrades available.

Secret mission cards
Forbidden cards.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hockey Chess
boardgame.description:
A hockey game using 6 chess pieces per side to represent, goalies, Forwards, Defenders, Centers, etc. Each chess piece has a two-number "skating ability" that it uses to move along the hockey rink as it tries to score a goal, or block an opponent. The chess pieces move on the rink along lines connected to boxes, so it is a point-to-point movement, in an attempt to get into scoring position.

A game is complete when one team has scored a goal. A longer version can be played by allowing 12 movement turns per team to complete one period of play with as many goals as can be scored within that 12 move period. After three periods have been completed the game is won by the team with the most goals.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tinners' Trail: Expansions Box
boardgame.description:
Contains the Arsenic and Emigration expansions.

Arsenic Expansion
The arsenic expansion adds the extra resource of arsenic. Due to the danger of arsenic, it is mined at the cost of PERMANENTLY losing work points but with the reward of a big cash payout.

Emigration Expansion
In The Emigration expansion, you can send your workers overseas to gain ongoing benefits, such as extra income or free improvements.

Contents:
1 Market board
5 Calciner meeples
20 Arsenic cubes
1 Emigration board
20 Miner meeples (4 per player)
8 Emigration tokens

listing.notes: Title: Tinners Trail: Deluxe Add Ons Publisher: Alley Cat Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The BMX Race Game
boardgame.description:
A simple roll & move race game with a few opportunities for delay by other players and obstacles on the board. Includes a folding board, dice and 4 standard bicyclist pieces.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Reit-Turnier
boardgame.description:
Players roll their show jumper over a start-finish course. Along the way, they can encounter squares with events that either set them back or let them advance further. The player who reaches the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive – Outcasts Gang Tactics Cards
boardgame.description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

18 Outcast Gang Cards
8 Blank Fighter Cards

Requires Necromunda Rulebook and Book of the Outcast to use.

boardgame.name: Dice Conquest
boardgame.description:
Take on a gauntlet of terrifying monsters either solo or in a group of up to 4 classic fantasy characters, with a set of 7 included polyhedral dice as your weapons! Can you survive long enough to defeat the mighty dragon Kalterstorm?

Each round you’ll draw three new monster cards, joining any leftover from the last round. Then, a player rolls all available dice, and players begin their turns. On your turn, you place any available die on a monster, doing that die’s value amount of damage. If the value matches your character’s critical hit number, you get to use your special ability as well! If the total damage is greater than that monster’s health, you defeat the monster, collect an item (if any), and move the dice back into the pool.
But it’s not always so simple! Many monsters have special requirements, like the Ogre who must be defeated before you can even target other creatures! Or the Gremlin, who can only be defeated with three damage EXACTLY!

It includes 8 Hero cards to try in different combinations as you attempt to survive to the end. Once you do, you can mix in more and more of the included Trap cards for an added challenge!

Dice Conquest is designed by Stephen Avery and Eugene Bryant, and features illustrations by Mirco Paganessi. It includes a beautiful set of 7 polyhedral dice, but players are also free to swap in their favorite set of dice instead!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Verliebte Jagd
boardgame.description:
A game for 2 teenagers in love. One takes the role of the hunter, the other the role of the little bird. After one round, the game is played again with swapped roles.
Both players move their figures by throwing the dice over a start-finish course. At the beginning of the game, the little bird has ducats, which must be paid out to the hunter every now and then. If the ducats run out, the bird must draw and fulfil task cards. These tasks are suitable for impressing shy teenagers from the 1970s. Example: "Dance with me." Whoever has the largest sum of ducats and task cards after both rounds wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Gears 5: Hivebusters
boardgame.description:
Return to Gears 5 with the new Hivebusters campaign expansion. Play as Lahni, Keegan and Mac – the heroes of Gears 5’s Escape mode – on their first operation as part of the secretive Hivebuster program. Thrown together and dubbed “Scorpio Squad,” their suicide mission to destroy a Swarm hive may hold the key to saving Sera and their own redemption.

• Enjoy a new, 3-hour campaign set on the volcanic Galangi islands. The island lava flows and sandy beaches are crawling with Swarm and a deadly new predator.
• Use and upgrade Ultimate Abilities in a campaign story setting for the first time.
• Up to 3-player co-op, split-screen or online.
• 16 new achievements to unlock for 210 Gamerscore.

boardgame.name: Achtung, frecher Frosch!
boardgame.description: Players hop their frog by dice roll across a pond of leaves to a field of water lilies to catch a fly and bring it to the finish line. On the way back, a frog may lose its fly to another frog. The first to reach his target field with a fly wins the game.

boardgame.name: Space Puppies
boardgame.description:
Space Puppies is a deck-building game for 2-5 players. Each player begins with 5 cards and can take 2 actions per turn: play a dog in front of you, play an action card, save a planet, or discard a card.

Once a player completes a set of dog cards, they choose one of the planets on the dog cards to save, thus earning points. Play continues in turn order, with each player taking 2 actions per turn.

The endgame trigger is chosen at the beginning of the game; the game can end when someone scores 40 points or when someone has saved 3 planets.

boardgame.name: Daddy Issues
boardgame.description:
Have you heard the story of the father who "went for cigarettes" and never came back? You play as that guy! The premise is simple: you win the game by getting a pack of cigarettes and returning home in one piece... but that ain't easy when the city is full of dangers, fat pigeons, criminals, and... werewolves?

The dangerous journey can cost you your life... or worse, make you late for your anniversary!











Daddy Issues was created for the 10th BGG Roll & Write contest. It is a highly thematic solo roll & write that combines dark humor, RPG-like narrative, and light management elements. Each run through the city is completely unique, as you roll the dice to explore, fight, and even draw your own map!











You will immerse yourself in a dangerous world of crime and the paranormal. You will be navigating the mean streets day and night while receiving texts from your family and making tough decisions. Time is not on your side, so make every choice count! Trust me, you really don't wanna miss your anniversary!

boardgame.name: Advanced Lovers & Lesbians
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Draw your sword and bare your heart with new character types, fresh settings, and even more ways to enjoy the game.

boardgame.name: Wayfarers of the Farwood: The Iron Thieves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lor'Zun is a young plane lorded over by gods that are more elemental forces than intellectual beings, in contrast to the usual pantheons of most other planes. Here, the gods don't actively interfere with most things but still change and shape the world by their mere presence.

boardgame.name: Wayfarers of the Farwood: The World of Lor'Zun
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everything on Lor'Zun, from civilization to wilderness, each stone and tree, the Gods and the mortals, all exist on the foundation that is the hidden harmony, a trinity between gods, magic, and metallic ore.

boardgame.name: Wayfarers of the Farwood: Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome wayfarer to Lor'Zun. It is the 139th cycle since the last great shift, when the world trembled and was born anew. You may not yet know who you are, where you're from or what your gods are, but you do know this.

boardgame.name: Tables-Tastic
boardgame.description:
Tables-Tastic is a fun family maths game for children aged 6+ that will help children learn their multiplication tables up to 12 x 12 without even realising they are learning.

Players start with a hand of seven cards each and the aim of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their cards. Each turn starts with the player rolling two dice, giving a number between 2 and 12, and they can play if they have a card in their hand in the correct times table.

Special rules if you roll a 7, 11 or a double add an extra layer of both strategy and luck. Feedback from customers is that the children are so engrossed in trying to work out whether they can play that they don't realise they are learning maths by stealth.

All packs come with "times table checker cards" for children (or adults) who are less confident with their times tables. The game can also be played solo for extra practice.

boardgame.name: The City of Dreams
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Entrusted with greater responsibility, you’ve been dispatched to I’Cath to find the Urn of Dreams. There, you must navigate the city and find a way into the Palace of Bones—the home of the domain’s Darklord. To accomplish this, you’ll need help from unlikely sources. Whatever you do, though, don’t fall asleep.

The eighth adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures. An adventure for 6th-level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: body horror (eyes, teeth), gore, death, children in peril, oppression (slavery, poverty, imposed insomnia), mental health (grief), self-harm.

boardgame.name: The Palace of Bones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Urn of Dreams lies somewhere within the Palace of Bones, and you’ve been tasked with finding it. Along the way, you learn you aren’t the only ones in pursuit of the elusive artifact. To have any hope of recovering the urn before your mysterious rival, you must discover the palace’s secrets, and use them to your advantage.

The ninth in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 6th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: nightmares, possession (loss of agency), gore (dismemberment), food (rot), abuse (stalking), death (execution, mention), confined spaces, oppression (slavery).

boardgame.name: Township
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sunlit has been revealed to be the Feywild domain of Empyrean, an archfey. Empyrean says Bettrothanixa is coming very soon, and with the town’s guards nowhere to be found, they will need a way to keep her domain from its clutches. She hatches a plan full of fey trickery to keep her domain safe, and now it’s time to execute it.

This is a four-hour Tier 2 APL 8 adventure. It does not follow directly from the previous Sunlit Hands and can be played as the start of a new trilogy.

boardgame.name: Airline (Adventure International)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A digital, turn-based board game in which competing airlines operating in the lower-48 states of the USA. One to four airline owners first purchase landing rights at various US airports, purchase fleets of aircraft, and collect revenue from flight operations. The game is played for a set number of turns as entered by the players at the start of the game. The winner is the player with the most money at the end of the game.

It is possible to start the game with only one to four computer players selected, for AI-only gameplay.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Texas Instruments cassette edition

boardgame.name: Travelogue
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After the face-stealing issue at Red Larch and hunting down the culprit in the Feywild, it’s time to tell Sunlit that something strange is happening. Unfortunately, it’s too late, and trouble has already found the travelling town. With Duelly’s help again, adventurers must rid the town of invading fey by using their own tricks and games against them, and at the same time unravel some of the town’s past.

This is a four-hour Tier 2 APL 8 adventure. It does not follow directly from the previous Sunlit Hands and can be played as the start of a new trilogy.

boardgame.name: Blank Stare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Storyteller’s Festival is taking place in Red Larch. Aimed at artists, travelers, and children, people from all around the Dessarin Valley have come to hear grand tales, buy books of fables, and sometimes show off their tale-weaving skills. As all seems to be going well, a stranger begins a tale about a magical town that can’t possibly exist. The problem? The town is real, and one of its guards is here to investigate how this stranger knows about it at all. Events take a turn for the worse, and a party of adventurers gets caught up in their own odd story involving fey, missing faces, stolen stories, and a new type of dragon.

This is a four-hour Tier 2 APL 8 adventure. It does not follow directly from the previous Sunlit Hands and can be played as the start of a new trilogy.

boardgame.name: Mit Quacks & Co. nach Quedlinburg
Quacks & Co.: Quedlinburg Dash
boardgame.description:
It's race day in Quedlinburg, and with the right combination of food and luck, you will ride your mount to victory and claim the golden cauldron.

Mit Quacks & Co. nach Quedlinburg features similar gameplay to The Quacks of Quedlinburg, with each player building their own bag of tokens over the course of play, then drawing those tokens to try to further themselves to victory.

Each player starts the game with their mount at the start of the racetrack and a bag that contains four dream tokens, a yellow 1 token, two red 1 tokens, and a red 2 token. On a turn, you draw a token from your bag, then place it on your animal board. If you draw a colored token, place the token on your animal board, advance your animal on the track as many spaces as the number on the token, then carry out the effect of that color: red tokens earn you 1-3 rubies, yellow tokens let you roll a die for a random bonus, green tokens let you take another turn or return a drawn token to your bag, and blue chips let you move extra or upgrade a token.

If you draw a dream token, place it on one of the clouds on your animal board. After you draw and place a third dream token, use all the rubies on your board to buy new tokens — no two being the same color, mind you — then place these new tokens and all previously drawn tokens in your bag. Keep taking turns until someone reaches the end of the track and wins!

Mit Quacks & Co. nach Quedlinburg includes a double-sided game board for a shorter or longer race; orange and purple tokens that provide new powers, such as advancing as many spaces as the number of rubies you have; and double-sided action boards for each type of colored token, allowing you to play with different sets of actions from game to game.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Children's Game Judges Award Winner
2022 UK Games Expo Best Children's Game Nominee
2022 UK Games Expo Best Children's Game People's Choice Award Winner
