listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 25 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 6+
Mit Quacks & Co. nach Quedlinburg Habt ihr schon mal von der Stadt Quedlinburg im Harz und ihrem berühmten Markt gehört, der dort alljährlich stattfindet?
Jedes Jahr, am Tag vor dem Markt, wird traditionell das große Wettreiten der Kinder der Stadt veranstaltet. Schön, dass auch ihr dieses Mal mit dabei seid! Mit dem Esel Quacks und seinen Freunden geht ihr an den Start und lockt die Tiere mit dem richtigen Futter vorwärts. Aber wir reden hier nicht von ganz normalem Tierfutter. Nein, unser Futter ist ein bisschen wunderlich. Nicht immer bringt es eure Vierbeiner gleich weit voran. Da heißt es, die richtige Kombination finden, um möglichst schnell zu sein. Aber manchmal hat sich auch ein Traumkraut in euren Beutel verirrt und euer Tier gönnt sich lieber eine kleine Pause…
Unterwegs sammelt ihr Rubine, mit denen ihr euch neues – vielleicht noch besseres – Futter kaufen könnt. Wer bringt sein Tier mit einer guten Mischung aus Taktik und Glück schnell voran, kommt als Spitzenreiter ins Ziel und gewinnt am Ende den goldenen Kessel?
✓ Das Kinderspiel zum Kennerspiel des Jahres 2018 ✓ Schnell erlernbares Spielprinzip ✓ Verschiedene Varianten für abwechslungsreichen Spielspaß
Inhalt: 62 Futter-Chips 18 Traumkraut-Chips 26 Kleeblätter 40 Rubine 4 Tiertafeln 1 goldener Kessel 4 Spielfiguren (Esel, Schaf, Schwein, Kuh) 2 Würfel 4 Futterbeutel 1 Spielplan (beidseitig bedruckt) 6 Aktionstafeln (beidseitig bedruckt) Beiblatt
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

Opened but never played. All components are unpunched.
Ships from 98332.
I do combine shipping. Please have a look at the other games I have for sale.
Thanks

boardgame.name: What Happens Under the Oak Tree
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

WHAT HAPPENS UNDER THE OAK TREE is a Christmas adventure starring first-year students staying in the Strixhaven campus during the winter break.

As a peaceful winter holiday is interrupted by an attack on the Strixhaven campus a band of students must prove their worth and be the heroes their peers will look up to. Use this a standalone tale, or implement it within a larger campaign as the characters ascend to become bright stars among the community.

This supplement includes an adventures for Tier 1 gaming groups, detailing locations, descriptions, and creatures in a few sessions that explore the world of Arcavios.

boardgame.name: Stixhaven: A Syllabus of Sorcery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book expands upon the content provided in Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos in order to provide DMs with more ways to customize their Strixhaven campaign. The information contained in this book is completely modularized and can be added wherever you see fit to enhance your game.

boardgame.name: Heroes of Strixhaven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Among those who walk these hallowed halls, you can find the future of Arcavios: guardians who will rise up against world-ending threats, warriors who will protect the common folk, scholars who will discover the secrets of the universe—even tyrants who will wield their power like bloodthirsty iron. The knowledge we teach here is neither good nor evil—but what you do with it is up to you.

This title introduces eight new subclasses themed around the colleges of Strixhaven.

boardgame.name: Soulmist: Time of Judgement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Time of Judgement is the first official adventure taking place in the world of Fyera.

The adventure was created for the purposes of the Open Beta Testing of the world setting Soulmist: A Journey from Darkness to Light and is available for free to the global community.

Time of Judgement consists of four (4) limited-duration acts (one shots) which can either take place independently or sequentially. In other words, they were created to be flexible, and can be played in any of the following ways:

a) Independently, by choosing any one of the 4 acts of your choice.
b) Sequentially, by starting from the first act and progressing towards the fourth.
c) In tandem, where four (4) groups of players can each select one act and explore it.

boardgame.name: Auch schon clever
Clever Junior
Très Futé! Kids
boardgame.description:
You want to get your hands on everything you can at the birthday party: balloons, gifts, candles, and mountains of sweets! Will you be able to grab more than all the other partygoers?

Auch schon clever features gameplay similar to Ganz schön clever, with one player rolling dice on their turn, then choosing what they want while everyone else gets something from what's left behind.

On your turn, roll the five dice. The faces of these dice show a joker symbol or an icon on one of four colored backgrounds. Choose all the dice of one background color, taking any jokers at the same time, then use the symbols on these die faces to mark off items in this colored area of your score sheet:


Balloons are in the yellow area, for example, and you must mark them off left to right: red, blue, green, lilac, blue, etc.
For the train of candles in the orange area, you must have as many candles as are on the next train car in order to mark it out.
Gifts in the green area can be marked off in any order.
Sweets in the blue area are depicted in pairs in rows — doughnuts, cake, cupcakes — and you mark spaces in a row left to right as long as you have a pair of matching sweets on the dice.


If you can't use a die that you took, e.g., you took red, blue and lilac balloons and could mark off only the first two, then you must return the unused dice to any others left behind. Each other player then chooses dice of a single background color — and players can choose the same or different colors — and marks off what they can.

If you mark off a circled item or a row of gifts next to a circle, you can immediately cross off an item in the section of the same color as that circle. Crossing off this item might give you another bonus!

When a player marks off all items in one area, the game ends at the conclusion of that turn. Various items or rows that you complete have rainbow stars connected to them, and whoever collects the most rainbow stars wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 5 Jahre
Auch schon clever Auf dieser Party ist tierisch was los: Luftballons, Kerzen, Geschenke und ganz viel Kuchen. Da ist für jeden etwas dabei. Wer die gewürfelten Symbole clever ankreuzt, ergattert viele Siegpunkte und Zusatzzüge. Aber Achtung! Alle Würfel, die ihr nicht verwendet, bleiben für die Mitspieler. So sind alle immer im Spiel und niemand muss lange warten.
✓ Kinderspiel/ Flip & Write-Spiel ✓ Die Kids-Version des erfolgreichen Würfelspiels „Ganz schön clever“ ✓ Schnell erklärt - schnell gespielt ✓ Auch gut geeignet für 2 Spieler
Inhalt: 5 Würfel 1 Spielblock 4 Bleistifte
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE
weight: 351 grams + packaging
played once
Title: Auch schon clever Publisher: Schmidt Spiele Language(s): German

boardgame.name: Aspect: An Essentialist RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Aspect is an ultra-lightweight tabletop RPG with a strong focus on make-believe.

Play any setting you want, be it fantasy, science fiction, western or cosmic horror.

Do anything you want. You won't have to look up rules, do maths or consult tables.

Everything in Aspect is quick and simple. Great for epic campaigns and badass one-shot adventures.

boardgame.name: Pixies: Role-Playing Adventures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Humans will know them by many names: Pixies, Brownies, Sprites, Fairies, Elves, Imps, Gremlins, Borrowers, and more. Pixies (as they call themselves) are tiny magical beings of fae origin who typically stand about as tall as an apple. They have survived and thrived across the Earth for countless millennia. Recently, though, their communities have been scattered and forced into the shadows during this modern world of technology, secularism, and globalisation. Individual Pixies can endure for hundreds of years, but they prefer to live in the now and relish every possible moment and sensation.

Pixies: Role-Playing Adventures is a group storytelling game about wee fae folk claiming their space in a human-sized world. This is a game of pranks, heroism, adventure, romance, and imagination. Yet unlike in a traditional board game, the possibilities for exploration and action in this role-playing game are endless.

boardgame.name: Wyrms: Role-Playing Adventures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the dawn of recorded time, Wyrms have ruled the skys of Khalud. They have an unassailable instinct to seek out the few remaining others of their kind. Not to mate or join in companionship, but to defeat them in combat, consume their hearts, and gain a measure of their powers. This intense drive to singular existence is the Great Fusion.

Wyrms discovered long ago that they could best achieve their goals by performing a ritual to divide their consciousness and physicality into several smaller entities. Through a process known as Sundering, the races of Dragonkind came into being.

Wyrms: Role-Playing Adventures is a group storytelling game about the eternal battles between massive flying beasts destined to consume their rivals. This is a game of battle, heroism, adventure, romance, and imagination. Yet unlike in a traditional board game, the possibilities for exploration and action in this role-playing game are endless.

boardgame.name: Demonicity: Role-Playing Adventures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are horrors so unimaginable that they can propel a person to the edges of their sanity. Evils so dark that they threaten to consume the world and plunge it into eternal night. Those threats manifest within terrible creatures from the hell dimension of Bazaroth, wielding incredible powers and hungering for domination. Demons are real, and they are arriving.

Your team of operatives is humanity’s last line of defence against the coming infernal darkness. Today, your adventure begins.

Demonicity: Role-Playing Adventures is a group storytelling game about Earth’s forsaken Demon City, and its emerging horrors that are breaking through from the hell dimension. This is a game of battle, heroism, adventure, romance, and imagination. Yet unlike in a traditional board game, the possibilities for exploration and action in thisrole-playing game are endless.

boardgame.name: Escape from the Museum
boardgame.description:
An ordinary trip to the museum turns into chaos when you find yourself locked in and all alone, after hours!

Will you be able to solve the 12 brain-busting puzzles, decode the alphabet on an ancient stone tablet, and find the key to your freedom before your time runs out?

This mini, collaborative escape room experience has an average play-time of 45 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Agropolis: Seasons
boardgame.description:
A 4-card expansion for Agropolis.

Shuffle and deal one additional scoring card from Seasons. When you draw a Seasons card, you must follow the placement rule on your Seasons Scoring Card.

listing.notes: Shipping will be $4, for the cards to be shipped well protected in a padded bubble mailer.
Shipping will be $4, for the cards to be shipped well protected in a padded bubble mailer.

boardgame.name: Pōpoki
boardgame.description:
OVERVIEW: You are a feral cat trying to leave the abandoned Royal Gardens subdivision on the Big Island of Hawai’i. You will try to make your way over a recent flow field of smooth, glassy pāhoehoe lava without hurting yourself. If you can make it to Highway 130, then maybe you’ll get picked up and taken to a shelter in the nearby town of Pahoa.

DETAILS: You roll dice to determine the journey the cat will take across lava. Along the way, you draft abilities by playing "akamai" cards. These allow you to change the path of your journeys, to avoid losing life points or whiskers. After six rounds, your score (whiskers multiplied by life points) reflects how well you survived the overall journey.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 18EUS
boardgame.description:
18EUS (Eastern United States) is an 18xx game that features elective personal loans. Players may either take loans to fund lucrative investments or invest in the Bank of New York if they do not have loans. The Bank grows stronger, and loans are worse, when more loans are taken and when someone invests in the Bank.

It also features a highly randomized setup with powerful private companies auctioned over three rounds, incremental capitalization with up to 100% company ownership, and a novel force-buy mechanism.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Century Golem All-In-One Board Game Insert
boardgame.description: Storage solution for Century Golem All-In-One (Century:Golem Edition, Eastern Wonders, & An Endless World). Not sized for sleeved cards. (Note also the Mystery Tales rule book will not fit inside either.) This insert allows for very easy setup and fantastic organization. You can fit all the boards on top of the printed parts and the pieces will not move or shift when moving the box. This will fit all pieces in the original box.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Century: Golem Edition
Century: Golem Edition – An Endless World
Century: Golem Edition – Eastern Mountains

boardgame.name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Lunar Warrior Luna
boardgame.description:
Switch up your gameplay with Luna! This Spellslinger is just as ecstatic to share her powers as she is to switch cards. Keep your opponent guessing with all new card effects—including "Word Wall," which gets stronger the more words your opponent has in their spell's text box—and super protective spells to keep you well in the game!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

boardgame.name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Prodigal Sorcerer Kyugen
boardgame.description:
Kyugen is back with a vengeance! Arm your deck with 16 new spells, and a new Kyugen character card with an ability that rewards you for playing Legendary and Signature spells! Kyugen has several tools at his disposal to dispatch threats with superior counters, blocking, and card draw, keeping you several steps above any opponent!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

boardgame.name: Wizard at War
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Fight your way through the corridors of the dungeons of the Wizard. Blast your way through waves of Barwars, and invisible Tharwars and Garwars. But watch out, once you clear out these monsters, you may find yourself up against the Warluk, or even the Wizard himself. For every five levels you complete, you will earn an extra life.

boardgame.name: Star-Fire (1980)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

It's a head-to-head duel in space. Two spaceships start positioned at opposite sides of the screen. Each ship can maneuver across it's own half of the screen, but cannot pass over to the opposing player's side of the screen. Sneak out from behind the static planetoids dotting the area and try and blast the other player's ship. It's a timed game, so you'll need to rack up as many kills as possible while dodging hostile fire. Highest scorer after time is up wins the game. Play against a human opponent or solo against the computer.

boardgame.name: Space-Vaders
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Maneuver your base back and forth across the bottom of the screen, blasting away at a descending phalanx of aliens and their orbiting saucer. Win an extra base for every 2,500 points that you score.

boardgame.name: Shark Attack
Terror at Selachii Bay
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

As the Captain of the ship you must manage the crew, supplies and repairs while trying to get a dangerous and unpredictable shark in the bay. We've lost a lot of Captains already!

User Summary

A turn-based strategy game of moving your boat around a grid, representing Selachii Bay, trying to harpoon a marauding shark. You need to harpoon the shark three times to vanquish it. During the search for the shark, your ship may encounter other hazards in the bay, including storms, floating mines, and shipwrecks.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Tape to Disk TRS-80 edition

boardgame.name: すみっコぐらし おさんぽカードゲーム (Sumikko Gurashi Card Game)
boardgame.description:
A game consist of 54 Cards (Can be used as standard poker card).
Most cards show a road on or pavement on it. Join the roads and pavement, first to play all the cards win.
A special placement rule for 8 sets of 3-cards combinations and 4 sets of 2-cards combinations.

boardgame.name: Cyborg (1980)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

In this scrolling-screen shooter, you drive a futuristic grav sled through labyrinthine complexes filled with hostile robots and mines. Your goal is to collect all signal modules from a level, which will allow you to move on to the next complex. Your sled has four speed settings and a shield which will allow you to drive over mines.

boardgame.name: Dessert Party
甜品學院
boardgame.description:
Designed in Hong Kong.
Players are pâtissiers, gathering fruits in the market to make tasteful pastries.
The best pâtissier make the highest value and number of pastries.
Strive to be the Best!

Simple Rules:

Move along the ring-shaped street with shops and supplies yourself with fruit's materials.
Using 5 identical fruit's material to upgrade to processed fruit. You may have to "borrow" your fellow pâtissiers to aid one's upgrade.
Produce one of the two requested dessert with your processed fruits. These dessert will act to your points and also give you special abilities to aid your gather/upgrade process.


Be the first to hit the point target and become the best pâtissiers.

There is a point target for different player count.

boardgame.name: The Warp: 5/6 Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
You can now enjoy even more epic games of The Warp by adding up to 2 extra players! The expansions adds all components for a fifth and sixth player. This way you can enjoy a fully competitive game with 5 or 6 players or you can play the 2 vs 2 vs 2 team mode.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Warp: Alien Pack
boardgame.description:
This pack adds 6 new aliens to The Warp for even more replayability. The aliens can be used as Player races, Exiled races or Warp Guardians.

Included aliens:

Orgu Scientists
Nera Seers
Gul Architects
Vens Enforcers
Caler Sentinels
Fal Bounty Hunters


This expansion is also playable with the 5/6 player expansion.
You need the base game to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Warp: Arok Undertakers
boardgame.description:
The Arok Undertakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

Player alien
Exiled forces
Warp Guardian


Their power will grant you an additional troop in your supply if you terrashift an area down to the lowest level.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Warp: Culpa Bookmakers
boardgame.description:
The Culpa Bookmakers were selected by the Kickstarter backers as an exclusive alien for the campaign.

They can be used in 3 different ways:

Player alien
Exiled forces
Warp Guardian


Their power introduces betting on the result of any combat during the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Case Geld: The Axis Invasion of North America, 1945-46
boardgame.description:
This two-player (solitaire adaptable) alternative history mini-monster has two mapsheets and one counter-sheet to cover the bicoastal invasion of North America by the Japanese and Germans (who have already conquered the rest of the world) at the army/corps level and 50 miles per hex. Command is split-sided. The player running the defense of the US west coast against the Japanese invasion there is also running the German east coast invasion, and the player running the US east coast defense against the German invasion there is also running the Japanese west coast invasion. Victory is possible by each of those four commands. Low-intermediate complexity.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Brand new in shrink wrap. Authorized dealer of Compass Games Products I am the owner of A Gray Rooster Sales LLC Ships same day as payment received from New Philadelphia, Ohio. PayPal Only. Sales Tax For Ohio Residents PM or email with any questions. sales@agrsales.com

boardgame.name: Mycosis
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Meat Fungus grows in isolated caverns, abandoned dungeons, and other dark cracks in the world. It is a veritable ecosystem of semi-autonomous creatures collectively sustaining the whole. The Meat Fungus keeps no treasure of its own—but the many adventurers who came before you left some behind…

MYCOSIS is a one-shot dungeon for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: The Shipwrecked
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Crash! When disaster struck, you were caught in its maw. Blown ashore by the winds of fate, you are still adrift. The night sky points the way back. Towards home.

You are alive, even after all that. Your care is uncommon, steadfast, and weather-worn.

The Shipwrecked is a playbook for out of place (perhaps even alien) animals. Someone who never meant to wind up in this part of Haeth. You're not exiled, and you're not on a pilgrimage. You're just unlucky. But maybe, just maybe the road can take you home again.

boardgame.name: The Invisible Friend
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A whisper in the ear. A glance at movement in the corner of the eye. The shape of the shadows in the moonlit night. You’re still here.

The Invisible Friend is a playbook for shy animals and/or players. Maybe you're someone's imaginary friend; maybe you're just more comfortable letting other people take the spotlight; maybe you're a ghost. But whoever you are, you're not alone. You are alive.

boardgame.name: The Place in the Bog
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

“Go to the place in the bog, find the source of those freaky plant-folk and destroy it!”

This is a short (one page!) adventure built around a small swamp-map that I drew. It's for about 3-4 low level adventurers and can be used with most old school fantasy roleplaying games.

Just wing it, roll some dice and have fun!

boardgame.name: Well-Gourded Village
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Visit the village of Grain Gourde for the traditional harvest festival to celebrate the end of Noddersmonth and usher in the new winter! Try out the pumpkin pie eating contest. Experience the Grand Residential Hotel inside the largest habitable gourd in the known vasty world! Hunt life-like rat analogues in the tavern cellars as you pretend to be an old-world re-renaissance dungeon delver! Visit the ancestral manor of the Autumnisle ancestors!

A few-page roleplaying location of exploration and investigation and camp.

- 4 pages
- 1 village panorama
- 2 maps
- 15 tables or so
- some assembly required (hey, it's an rpg!)

boardgame.name: Little Bones
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Basically Maze Rats with a dusting of Tunnel Goons and a large spoonful of Basic Dungeons, but stripped back to fit on a double-sided A5 page, and sped up for one-shots, picnics, and parties. These rules work great with both kids and adults.

Little Bones is played with 2d6. If you would like to play this game with, say, a single giant foam d12 instead then try Big Bone.

Includes pre-rolled characters, a spell generator, stat suggestions for creatures and NPCs, and an adventure builder.

boardgame.name: Gudnak
boardgame.description:
Gudnak (the Orcish word for "War") is a tactical card game played on a 3x3 grid with easy to learn rules and deep tactics. Players choose a faction, build a deck of heroes and then compete to siege their opponent's keep while defending their own.

Gudnak offers surprising tactical depth both in gameplay and deckbuilding while maintaining easy to grok rules. Ultimately Gudnak is a game about using your fighters to the best of their abilities so that your army outlasts your opponents.

Gudnak is set in a fantasy world who's star is dying. The lowering temperatures have caused massive political changes in the world as people find ways to stay fed and stay warm. The core set pits two factions against one another. The Refractory are a religious group who believe that the sun is a god who is punishing them. They build keeps and monuments in areas of the world where sunlight is strongest. The Shardsworn are a shaky alliance who use power derived from chunks of meteorites to stay warm. The Refractory believes using these Shards is angering their god, while the Shardworn need to roam farther and farther into Refractory lands to gather food.

Looks like this world is primed for conflict.

boardgame.name: Pocket Pennant Run
boardgame.description:
Pocket Pennant Run is the only full-fledged baseball simulation that fits in the palm of your hand! Using just a few simple charts and an intuitive multi-point player rating system, teams and players from yesterday and today come to life, performing just like their real-life counterparts. Pocket Pennant Run is simple enough to be learned in minutes, yet steeped in enough strategy and realism to appease even the most experienced tabletop gamers - it’s tabletop baseball like it oughta be!

To play, simply roll three 12-sided dice and refer to the cards for the play result. Game ends at the end of nine innings and the team with the most runs wins.

boardgame.name: Alias: Suklaaversio / Chokladutgåva
boardgame.description:
The game is to be played in at least two teams, each team consisting of at least two players.

Each player gets two chocolates from the box, and the teams then take turns explaining ALL of the five words on one of the word cards. If the team manages to explain and guess all the words on the card, they get to take one chocolate from the box. If not, they return one chocolate to the box.
The team that collects the most chocolate gets to eat them in the end.

The box contains the rules, 40 game cards and 32 pieces of milk chocolate.

boardgame.name: Evolution: Warning Call Alternate Art Card
boardgame.description: Alternate art 'Warning Call' cards (7) for Evolution base game. Came in Evolution: The Beginning.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Evolution

boardgame.name: Happy Hats Beginning Reading Game
boardgame.description:
Players journey through the alphabet in this board game, creating 3-letter words along the way and collecting Hat tokens as rewards for successfully creating words."

Each player starts the game with 5 word ending cards. They spin the spinner and move to a spcace, ahich has a letter that use to begin a word. If the can spell a word with one or more cards, using the first letter from the board, they get a hat token.

The game is over when all players reach The End. The player who collected the most Hat Tokens during the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Tanto Cuore
boardgame.description:
Tanto Cuore is a Japanese deck-building card game for 2-4 players where each player plays as the Lord of a mansion and hires maids to fill out their house to become the best Master of the House around! The end goal is simple enough, the player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins! Players acquire Victory Points by employing a variety of maid cards that allow for different strategies when played together. You can even employ more interesting, unique maids that stick around to use their special powers each per turn! But beware, your opponents can make your maids sick or give them bad habits, affecting your maids in negative ways and decreasing your Victory Points! Do you have what it takes to run the best Mansion?

From Steam

boardgame.name: Quiz Kids
boardgame.description:
Race along the board and be the first to reach the number 100. Players move by rolling a die and choosing either to move that many places, or gambling to double their movement by answering a question.

There are also spaces where you can jump ahead of your opponents (or slip behind them) based on your trivia knowledge.

With 2880 questions across six topics, this game is aimed at kids between the ages seven and fourteen and has handicap rules to balance the game across ages.

boardgame.name: Merger
boardgame.description: MERGER is a single player role-playing game about trying to survive against living predatory corporations. While the game is certainly a metaphor for living in late-stage capitalism, it is also quite literal. Corporations in MERGER are large, faceless, monstrous entities that span time-zones and continents, gestalt organisms built of millions of individuals. We made them but they answer to no one. They use us to reproduce, feed, and defend themselves. (From KS Campaign)

boardgame.name: King's: Cards & Creations
boardgame.description:
King’s: Cards and Creations is a Tabletop Card Game Engine that uses the customizable Core 135 Creation Card set to make and play different games; each with alternate and/or additional rules - letting players also customize their game play. Players are able, and encouraged, to write and/or draw on their Creation Cards.

The Core release, between website and rule book rules, contains 5 different games; Kingdrin, Minkingi, Fwords, Creca, and Pazuuru.

In Minkingi, 2 (or potentially more) players use Creation Cards to battle on what is known as the Active Field, vying for the most board control by the end of the game. Players take turns placing one of their cards into an open Active Field space, rotated in any direction to fit the orientation of the space, then declaring battles with other spaces. The player who controls the most Active cards at the end of the game, is the winner.

Kingdrin, however, plays completely differently! 2, 3, 4 or even 5 or more players pool their Creation Cards to one pile, then everyone draws 7 cards. Players take turns declaring and playing cards on top of the Ditch, matching different symbols or numbers to the top ditch card, drawing when they can't. Things get intense when players add 'The Kingdrin Speed Rule' card; and turn order is replaced with players playing as fast as they can! The player who runs out of cards first is the winner.

Creca, while similar to Minkingi, is a much deeper dive into player engagement. Deck and drafting construction, Skills and abilities, as well as heavier gearing towards Card Layouts and new Fields. It uses the Active Field as well, but instead players are racing to control the first five Active Cards at the end of a turn. Creca also implements longer player turns, with different steps in each turn, giving players more choices (and hard decisions!) to deduce optimal plays from.

With player made content (on cards or in games), different games running under one engine (and many more in the works!), and expandable content through Card Layouts like Alt Rule Cards, Source Cards, and Token Cards; the potential is actually endless.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Legacy of Yu
Legado de Yu
boardgame.description:
During the reign of Emperor Yao, the people of ancient China were constantly plagued by deadly floods along the Yellow River. Eager to put an end to the devastation, Yao selected Gun, one of his officials, to devise a plan. After nine years of failed attempts using dams and dikes, Gun's employment came to a questionable end. After his passing, Yu inherited his father's work. Learning from Gun's failures, Yu set out to construct a series of canals to direct the surging river into nearby fields and smaller waterways.

Legacy of Yu is a solo-only, fully-resettable, nonlinear campaign game in which you step into the role of the legendary hero of the Xia Dynasty, Yu the Great. It will be your job to build the canals ahead of the impending flood, while also defending your growing village against neighboring barbarian tribes. With each game, stories will be shared and new gameplay elements added. The campaign features a self-balancing system which adapts to how well you are doing. The campaign ends once you either win or lose seven games.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Amelia Earhart: Around the World Flight
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

Amelia Earhart ​simulates the around-the-world flight attempt of the famous aviatrix in 1937. If you load enough fuel and pay attention to maintenance and repairs, you will have no trouble reaching Southeast Asia. From there on, it is tough going.

In this simulation uotake the place of the most famous aviatrix of all time. Flying in the cockpit of a twin-engine Lockheed Electra, you face the same decisions and hazards Amelia Earhart faced in 1937.

Prior to each flight, you are given information about your physical condition, the distance to the next destination, and the current weather. Once aloft, you may encounter a variety of problems: headwinds, heavy rain, engine malfunctions, excessive fuel consumption, and navigation difficulties.

Of course, your skill as an aviator is unquestioned, but to increase your chances of survival, remember the following:

• To find out the condition of the field before each landing, you attempt to contact someone on the ground — sometimes successfully, sometimes not. Should the runway be excessively muddy, you have the option to turn back.

• In case of a malfunction, you are asked if you want to make repairs, which, of course, take time. Not making repairs, however, substantially increases the probability of a major problem in the future.

• Similarly, your engines and other mechanical components will last longer if they are maintained judiciously. Flying for more than 40 hours between engine overhauls dramatically increases the probability of malfunction.

• You must balance the relationship between fuel consumption and weight. At 150 mph, the Electra gets approximately two miles per gallon. Bad weather increases fuel consumption.

User Summary

A text turn-based game by David H. Ahl, similar to the types of games published in his earlier Computer Games books, but on a grander scale to take advantage of late-eighties IBM PC processing power.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American type-in BASIC program listing

boardgame.name: Blockade (TRS-80)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A simple two-player arcade/action game for the TRS-80 Model I. The game is similar to other snake/blockade games where each player controls a growing line on the screen and attempts to be the first to block the other player's path. There are two options for the playing field, however. One playing field has a solid boundary surrounding the it which players must avoid running into. The other playing field is "spherical." When a player's snake/trail gets to the edge of the screen, it reappears on the opposite side as if moving around a sphere. As was the case with some of the earliest TRS-80 games, "sound effects" can be experienced through the use of an AM radio placed near the computer.

boardgame.name: The Convenience Store
boardgame.description:
The Convenience Store | 夜勤事件 is a J-horror game about a college girl on a night shift.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Beast from the Lightless Depths
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Long ago your kind had formed an ancient peace treaty with those from the lightless depths vowing never to step foot in each other's domain again. One such behemoth, the Beast, has now broken this treaty.
boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: The Census-Taker
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Across Hæth, there are all sorts of people. Kith of every stripe and kind. You’ve been tasked with learning about them, as much as you can. The world is large, and the road is long. Better get going.

The Census-Taker is a playbook for working animals - animals who might have a tougher time letting themselves fall into whimsy. Would you be on the road if it weren't for this job? Would you like to be?

boardgame.name: Mandala Stones: Dice Tower 2021 Objective Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 4 extra end of game objective cards labeled #X0 through #X04, giving players new ways to score points!

Part of Pack E from the 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Ancient Elements RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ancient Elements RPG is based upon the open Primary Fantasy SRD 3.5, Microlite20, and my own house rules. The goal is to create an OSR set of rules that conforms to the Primary Fantasy SRD 3.5 while maintaining some of the character and simplicity of Microlite20 so that standard 3.5 adventures and settings can be used without too much conversion.

boardgame.name: Anime 5E Character Folio
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Your fantasy anime and manga characters can't be expected to keep all their notes on random pieces of parchment.

They deserve their own Anime 5E Character Folio.
boardgame.rpgseries: Anime 5E: Fifth Edition Fantasy Role-Playing Adventures

boardgame.name: Candlekeep & Strixhaven Bestiary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Candlekeep & Strixhaven Bestiary aims to be a complementary work to the Candlekeep Mysteries and Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos. Monsters, NPCs, and magical items found in this book can be encountered in libraries, magical academies, wizard's towers, temples and arcane ruins.

In total, there are 29 stat blocks in this book for the Dungeon Masters to spice up and enrich their games when the players enter a library or a similar place of learning and knowledge. Book also contains the Translator character background and 8 wondrous magic items.

boardgame.name: Lorehold's Magical Mysteries
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Being a collection of magic items as studied by the Strixhaven student Quintorius Kand.

I’ve always been curious, I suppose. When I won the scholarship to Strixhaven, I felt like I’d struck gold! If ever there was a place I could find out all manner of wonderful things, it’s here. Being able to go out and uncover ancient magical secrets is heaven for me.


— Quintorius Kand

boardgame.name: Asteroid Field X
boardgame.description:
In Asteroid Field X, you play as one of four factions mining an inhospitable asteroid belt. The object of the game is to build and upgrade mining infrastructure to both keep your colony alive and protected and to mine and sell as much precious ore as possible. The faction that accumulates the most Creschins (money) from their sales will win the game. However, there is an “X-factor” in play: buried somewhere in the uncharted regions of this asteroid field is a mysterious alien artifact that emits terrifying forms of energy. It is of great value in this hyper-capitalist world, and of equally great danger. If you unearth it and manage to transport it back to your base dome, you can sell it to the ore transport ships for an enormous profit. But given the difficulty of handling it, someone else might steal it before you can accomplish this!

Asteroid Field X is a limited edition game by Zach Horton. It is based upon a prototype he designed in 1992. It functions as a prequel to Supernova, an origin story about a civilization’s extractavist excesses, when mining colonies supplied the raw materials to fuel a powerful but fragile empire—before Object X caused their home star to become unstable, leading to the desperate conditions of Supernova.

Players build and upgrade mining infrastructure in order to extract base metals (not very valuable, but needed to manufacture equipment), premium metals (the chief export of the mining colony, but also used to manufacture some items), and volatile compounds (substances needed to maintain your colony such as water and minerals). Beyond strategizing between the payoffs of these substances, you need to maintain transportation networks to return your ore safely to your base dome. You may build various other units to be used for sabotage, protection, or direct attacks. Asteroid Field X makes extensive use of hidden movement, and ships can be equipped with cloaking devices to render their locations invisible to other players. Many cargo cards offer special capabilities to players who develop and play them. Some of these are played covertly and revealed anonymously, to often unpredictable results. Combined, these mechanisms allow players to pursue secret campaigns of sabotage, openly hostile actions, and peaceful diplomacy, often all at once!

After all players have taken their turn, each round ends with a “diplomatic phase” in which players simultaneously manufacture new units, deploy covert cards that will be revealed in the next round, and decide how much ore to sell to the waiting merchant ships. The base prices of metal ore fluctuate during the game, as they are tied to a semi-randomized timeline of market cards. The final price that each player receives for their ore, however, is determined by how much total ore is dumped on the market that round by all players. Thus betting and bluffing play a significant role, as players attempt to manipulate the market to favor their own interests. After 12 rounds (each represented by a Market card), the game ends, with the player who has received the most money declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Mimsy's Strixhaven Shop of Treasures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The elvish student only half-believed the stories she’d been told until she investigated herself. A secret shop of magical wares that wanders from room to room under the very noses of the deans and professors? It seemed like the sort of story seniors would tell first-years to watch them run around like headless chickens looking for it. Nonetheless, she was a Lorehold mage, and she never left a stone unturned—a principle that brought her all the way to a Witherbloom supply closet in the middle of the night.

Feeling distinctly foolish, the student looked both ways, then turned the doorknob and quickly stepped inside. She expected to knock her nose against brooms and mops; instead, she found herself in a cluttered room lit by floating candles and stuffed with bizarre items. At the far end of the room, a horned woman watched her from behind a counter with bright eyes, her hands folded on the table. “I love first-time customers,” the woman murmured, sending a blush of embarrassment through the student’s cheeks. “That look of delight and confusion is a treasure itself.”

boardgame.name: Trinkets of Strixhaven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This supplement introduces 100 new trinkets that you may find exploring the magical university of Strixhaven.

The trinkets presented in this supplement are inspired by the wonders and mysteries of the magical University of Strixhaven. They will bring an additional layer of depth to any Strixhaven based campaign. Many of the curiosities are designed as plot devices to inspire side quests and one-shot adventures in and around the university of Strixhaven.

boardgame.name: Students of Strixhaven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos, we are introduced to a number of potential peers, friends, rivals, and lovers that can accompany the player characters throughout the campaign. Introduced in Chapter 3, these individuals are given two or three paragraphs of description, alongside some pseudo mechanical benefits or drawbacks depending on how you interact with them.

Within this publication, each of these students are given multiple statblocks to represent their growth throughout the four years of the Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos campaign. Each of them can grant their friends a unique bonus in addition to those benefits seen in the campaign book.

By providing statblocks for each student as they progress through the campaign, Dungeon Masters now have an easy go-to reference, detailing all of the student's traits and features at a glance. It also provides smaller parties with easy-to-use sidekicks, and opens the floor for combat featuring these NPCs if tensions rise or dangers to Strixhaven spill over into the student body at-large.

boardgame.name: 50 Magic Items from the School of Strixhaven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This compendium includes 50 magic items and six original color illustrations by fantasy artist Kelsey Yappel, all designed to bring your Strixhaven campaign to life!

boardgame.name: Course Catalog and Staff Directory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strixhaven Supplemental Volume I: Course Catalog and Staff Directory is a companion to Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos. This first volume contains 127 new and unique classes, each with their own punny or humorous name, to offer your players during their time at school. Each class comes with example ideas for DMs to use in terms of homework assignments, lab sessions, and exams as well as associated skill checks and other rolls for DMs to use for roleplay purposes.

Each class in this book comes with it's own reward. Using the school setting each player essentially can learn magic like a Wizard without needing to multiclass and gains spells for successfully passing classes. These spells are meant to be used instead of the spells granted in the new, published backgrounds.

Additionally included are 31 new professors and staff of all manner of races and gender identities, each with their own personalities and backstories. There are also additional details on the published faculty so DMs have more than two to three sentences to use when building personalities for the published faculty.

boardgame.name: The Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strixhaven Supplemental Volume II: The Rulebook is meant to be a companion to Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos. This content contains rule additions which can be optionally used by DMs to add a level of realism to their campaign.

boardgame.name: Creature Compendium and Item Index
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strixhaven Supplemental Volume III: Creature Compendium and Item Index is a companion to Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos. This third volume contains 11 new magic items using different artifacts and equipment from the Strixhaven and Commander 21 MTG sets as inspiration.

Additionally included are 13 normal creatures and 8 legendary creatures with inspiration taken from the MTG cards. Each college has at least one legendary creature associated with it and Extus and the Blood Avatar round out the collection for DMs who may wish to have their players pursue an evil greater than Murgaxor. Several of the legendary creatures employ unique encounter mechanics that will challenge even veteran players but remain thematic and relevant to the cards, lore, and setting.

This companion ends with several ideas on flavoring existing stat blocks to build other Strixhaven creatures DMs may wish to use.

boardgame.name: The Bulletin Board
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strixhaven Supplemental Volume IV: The Bulletin Board is intended to be a companion to Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos. Contained within are 43 extracurriculars including 27 originals run by professors and staff from Volume I and expanded notes and associated rolls from the 16 published extracurriculars (after all, why does the Dead Language Society use Athletics and why does the Show Band use Sleight of Hand?).

Also included within is a small amount of additional details on jobs along with ideas for five freelance positions students can take in their third or fourth years. These jobs are higher risk but higher reward.

Finally I've included two different versions of silkball! WotC provided very little to go on for Silkball rules but I looked more closely and found 8 different facts about silkball from the book. Each version of the game uses a magical item which is also included in these pages.

boardgame.name: Hook-up Break-up
boardgame.description:
In the game of love, there are many obstacles to overcome—from the influence of other people to infidelity. Do you think you have what it takes to make your relationship successful despite temptation and the negative influence of others? Can you overcome those barriers and live with your partner happily ever after?

Hook-up Break-up is a game that focuses on you, your relationship with your partner, and the people around you who will either positively or negatively affect that partnership.

On their turn, players roll the dice. This will determine whether they move forward, backward, draw a card or take action (influence a relationship, use a wild card to his favor or against others)

The winner is the player who reaches the end of the relationship meter before others. It's where he reached the maturity of his relationship and considered married.

boardgame.name: Great War Commander: Battle Pack Nr1
boardgame.description:
Great War Commander Battle Pack Nr1 is the first of what will be many themed scenario packs for use with the Great War Commander series of games.

This first Battle Pack is focused on the western front with actions opposing the German forces to the US, British, French and even Portuguese troops.

This Battle Pack features 12 new scenarios - one of which is an amphibious assault - as well as a thrilling Verdun campaign.
It also includes 2 stunning new maps and 113 new counters with new units (French Foreign Legion), new tanks (mark I), and new weapons (37mm infantry gun).

—description from the designer

COMPONENTS
Two new maps (maps 23 & 24)
Twelve new Scenarios (see below)
One Verdun campaign
113 die-cut counters
28 additional counters to correct BEF colorization

Rules for Smoke, Beach terrain and updated Artillery table
The Verdun campaign is played in a series of linked "battles". It portrays the April 1916fights for the Mort Homme and Côte 304.
Map 23 depicts a specific location: Hill60 (accurate to actual trench map)

The scenarios in GWC: BP Nr1 include:


33 "Étrépilly" French (Zouaves and Chasseurs) vs Germans, 7 September 1914;
34 "Race to the Bridge" British (Royal Marines) vs Germans, 9 October 1914;
35 "Garibaldi Legion" French Foreign Legion (Italian volunteers) vs Germans, 26 December 1914;
36 "Hill 60 Chapter I" British vs Germans, british mining and attack on Hill 60 17 April 1915;
37 "Hill 60 Chapter II" British vs Germans, german counterattack on Hill 60 18 April 1915;
38 "Landships" Canadians vs Germans, first appearance of the tanks (Mark I) 15 September 1916;
39 "Primera Patrulha" Portuguese (CEP) vs Germans, 2 June 1917;
40 "Operation Hush" British vs Germans, the amphibious assault that never was, August 1917;
41 "Following the Tanks" Highlanders vs Germans, 20 November 1917;
42 "Faverolles" French vs Germans, 3 June 1918;
43 "Guillemont Farm" US vs Germans, 29 September 1918;
44 "Fast and Frious" US vs Germans, Sgt York's Medal of Honor, 8 October 1918;


NOTE: GWC:BP Nr1 is not a complete game and requires ownership of both Great War Commander and Great War Commander: BEF to play.

boardgame.name: The Teams Courtyard (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
When the construction of that courtyard was completed, everyone realized that they were part of the same community. Something bigger than the mere sum of their individualities. Something that reunited them with an unprecedented force regardless of their origins, their beliefs, or their social stratum... at that moment they stopped competing and started helping each other, sharing the infrastructures and resources that this new and beautiful city was offering them.
This commemorative tile was created by Carcassonne.cat for the first online team world championship of Carcassonne on the Boardgamearena platform (WTCOC 2020).

• RULES FOR TILE PLACEMENT:
This tile is mixed with the rest of the tiles in the game. The player who draws it can place it following the standard rules of the game. Note that the tile has the city on all 4 sides and these are joined at the corners (it's not a dividing tile, it's quite the opposite).
The city that contains The Teams Courtyard tile will not take into account the regular system of who has the most meeples to designate who wins the points for that city (completed or not). You only need to have at least 1 meeple in order to get points from that city. The player who plays The Teams Courtyard tile will be able to place an additional farmer in the yard if he wishes to.

boardgame.name: Death Ride Normandy: CW Air-Maintenance-Logistics Enhancement
boardgame.description:
This enhancement provides Air, Maintenance, and Logistics elements to support the Commonwealth forces in the Normandy campaign.
This enhancement provides the Commonwealth player with the entire II British Tactical Airforce. Additional maintenance recovery units, supply transport units, and supply units, all spell extra detail that players will appreciate.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Roads of Europe (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion has been designed by Carcassonne.cat to celebrate the first European (Online) Team Championship. In doing so, we have encapsulated elements of the global Covid-19 pandemic such as the recommendation to use a protective mask to minimize the spread of the virus, and the need for self-isolation among those who may have been in contact with it.
Thus, the meeple with stars between the two roads depicted on the tile symbolizes the geographical context of the championship and the exceptional situation in Europe, and throughout the rest of the world.

Setup

The Roads of Europe tile should be mixed in with the other tiles as usual

How to use the tile

Following the basic rules for laying tiles, proceed as normal according to the following cases.

In 2-player games, promote a more competitive use

When a player draws this tile and places it such that it extends a road (or roads), any meeple(s) occupying these roads must immediately be removed from them without scoring. These meeples have been in contact with the virus and must go home to self-isolate! The active player must then place each removed meeple into separate incomplete and unoccupied cities of his choice, somewhere on the landscape. Meeples may not be moved into any city that is already occupied.
If there are not enough unoccupied cities available to accommodate all removed meeples separately, the active player chooses which meeples to place and which to return to their owner. After all removed meeples have either been moved to cities or returned to their owners, the active player is granted a bonus turn and must draw a new tile and place it according to the usual rules.
If the tile is placed on an unclaimed road (i.e. one without a meeple), it may not be claimed by the active player and no bonus turn is given.
The road may be extended on subsequent turns, but may not be claimed until such time that it is completed. The player that completes the road may choose to claim and score it, as per the usual rules, as long as they have at least one meeple in their supply.

With 3 or more players, promote a more playful and fun use -

The rules for games with more than two players follow the same rules as outlined above for games with two players, but with one exception: when the road is closed, all players who have not closed the road will lose as many points as there are tiles on the road.

Special cases


While meeples may never be placed as thieves on any of the road segments on the special tile, the fields are safe from the virus and may be claimed according to the usual rules by a meeple as a farmer.



There may be a situation where the placement of the special tile automatically closes a road. In that case, if there are meeples on it, they would return to their owners and the player who placed the tile would not be able to claim the road and the other players would not lose points either.



In the case of playing with expansions, all the tiles with special effects would disappear as part of the road expansion before closing. In any case, the tokens could still be used as normal tokens. Example: The mini tunnel expansion contributes to the expansion of the road without adding any special effects, but the princess and the dragon or inns and cathedrals contain symbols that are canceled when they are part of the road.

boardgame.name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol II
boardgame.description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol II (Serpents of the Seas) is an official expansion to Serpents of the Seas by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 255 individually named ships included with Serpents of the Seas. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Serpents of the Seas. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Serpents of the Seas. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the British, French, and American fleets. There are insufficient Spanish, Venetian, and East India Company ships to form a fleet, but these ships can be included in the fleets of the other nationalities as desired or added to the cards from the first volume of Beat to Quarters.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Serpents of the Seas!
Card play modifications to Flying Colors.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Magnate: The First City – KS Note
boardgame.description:
A pack of twenty 10M KS Commemorative Banknotes.

These were given to all backers of the Kickstarter.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Magnate: The First City

boardgame.name: Mystery House: Flashlights
boardgame.description: Set of four flashlights specifically designed for use in Mystery House.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Mystery House: Adventures in a Box

boardgame.name: Nordens ark Familje-Qiuz
boardgame.description: In the Nordens Ark Familje-Quiz, everyone, regardless of age, can test their knowledge of animals, nature and the environment. The game includes children's questions for the youngest, junior questions from 8 years and senior questions from 15 years and up. The game is quick and easy. Roll the dice to decide your question. If you answer correctly, you can take an animal badge out of the "secret bag". If the animal on the badge is the same as on the question card, you may take another badge. Who, with the help of knowledge and a little luck, first manages to gather three identical animal badges to win?

boardgame.name: Treasures of Olympus
boardgame.description:
The Olympian gods are up to their usual mischief, again! In this Greek mythological game, you'll assume the hidden identity of an Olympian god. Zeus has granted you the ability to wield his Thunderbolts in a Tournament of the gods. You’ll capture mythological creatures as you build an army to command in an epic contest for fame, fortune and most of all, bragging rights in Olympus. In this mystically veiled bidding and battling game, the god that scores the most points wins.

This is a fun, fast paced action game that is played in three distinct phases, the capture, command and scoring phases. As part of the game, there is a hidden god role card that each player has assumed. Only the gods know when you'll reveal your god identity and how your divine power will be used to enhance your play and stifle others.

In the capture phase, using a bidding style mechanic, you’ll use your limited supply of Thunderbolt tokens to capture mythological creatures from around the table. Gathering information is a key element of this phase because each player will only be allowed to see the creature’s strengths on other players stands. Their own creature card will be on a stand facing away from them and therefore unknown. So, if you surrender, you’ll need to take the lowest strength creature you can see.

After the capture phase, each player will then command their army of mythological creatures to battle for treasures! This phase is an epic competition for various treasures (gold, armor, valor, temples and worshippers) that only interest the gods. Treasure cards have different point values that range between 1 - 10 and various symbols that are part of your set collections and end game scoring. But be aware that worshippers, the 9 and 10 point value treasure cards, don't have any symbols while the gold, the 1 and 2 point value treasure cards have a wild symbol that can be used in any one of your set collections.

After all the battling and treasure collecting is done, it’s time to move into the scoring phase and tally up your scores. Unused thunderbolts, treasure cards, set collections (combination of creatures and treasure cards) and any god card bonuses all count towards your grand total. The player, or Olympian god with the most points wins and gets bragging rights in Olympus... for now.

boardgame.name: Cuistot Fury
boardgame.description:
Cuistot Fury is a competitive team game for 2 to 9 players divided into 2 to 3 brigades of cooks. Their goal: to prepare the best recipes and serve all their customers, in a fierce time trial where every second is precious.

When it's your turn:

Chose the recipe to prepare. The more complicated the recipe, the more points you get
Cook as a team


Ingredients and ustensils cards are split between the cooks of the team. Coordinate to make recipes by stacking the cards on the cooking board in the relevant order, before the end of the hourglass!

Serve the customers


The hourglass helps you put pressure on your competitors, since the faster you are, the less time they have to cook.
Advanced rules can also add more fun in the competition, with combo mechanisms to serve several customers at the same time, funny challenges for your opponents, and special powers...

boardgame.name: Talaref
boardgame.description:
Talaref is a trivia game that revisits the 90s and 2000s

The goal is to accumulate the most "refs" (the points in the game) alone or in team, by answering correctly questions on TV shows, music, cinema, news, sports... related to the 90s and 2000s !

When it's your turn, roll the dice.
If it's a category, answer the question to win the card and the associated "refs". The more difficult the question is, the more refs you get (from 1 to 3).
The dice can also indicate a challenge. In this case, compete with your friends by proprosing an answer on the topic described on the card, one after the other. The winner can steal a card to its opponent :)

600 cards
900 questions
150 challenges

boardgame.name: Darkstar: Tactical Starship Combat in the 26th Century
boardgame.description: Darkstar is a tactical war game postulating naval combat in a “science faction” universe set five centuries into a troubled and uncertain future. Players take command of warships serving in the new “black water” navies of reborn empires of old, struggling for control of shipping lanes, resources, and colonies. Ships maneuver and fire in fast-paced combat, with survival not only of the players’ fleets at stake, but perhaps their nation and all of humanity as well.

boardgame.name: Family Telly Addicts
boardgame.description:
Based on the popular BBC TV show of the 80's and 90's, be the first player to get all four of your Star Tokens around the board and back to your remote control.

Along the way, answer questions to double your move, or take on the "Hoofer Doofer". Hoofer Doofer squares involve your opponents guessing a TV prgogramme via either an impression, charade or hummed theme tune.

Some tactics take place with up to two of your tokens on the board at any one time, as you have to decide whether to play it safe or risk gifting an opponent an extra move.

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Extended Art Hero Cards
boardgame.description: 6 extended art promo cards: Legolas, Beravor, Bilbo, Elena, Aragorn, Gimli
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth

boardgame.name: babaOrum: Le choc des chefs!
boardgame.description:
babaOrum is a board game that plunges you into the world of pastry. To win the clash of the chefs, take your chance and be strategic!

Each player is a baker with a special ability. At the beginning of the game, each player receives an order which is his secret objective and indicates the recipes he has to make to win the game.

Each player is also given face-up recipes that he or she can make.

When it's his turn to play, a player can:

First, validate a pastry he prepared in the previous turn if relevant
Then, try to win recipe, ingredient or action cards, either by betting on luck, or by betting on strategy, or by answering a question about pastry
Finally, he can play action cards from his hand, or prepare one of his recipes with the ingredient cards he has in his hand.


The action cards spice up the game, by allowing to exchange or steal cards, to exchange the chefs' special abilities... In short, nothing is won in advance!

As soon as a player has finished preparing the recipes on his secret order, he wins the game!

boardgame.name: Mars (1984)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Description

YOUR MISSION IS TO EXPLORE THE MYSTERIOUS PLANET MARS!

An ancient civilisation once thrived here. You must find as many of the treasured relics from this long lost culture as you can, return them to your rocket ship, and blast off for good old Earth. But watch out - some items you will find may be worthless junk that will have a negative effect on your score. Some of the junk might, however, come in handy during your explorations of the Red Planet.

You will encounter a number of Martian beasts and monsters during your travels. Different types of creatures must be handled in different ways. The successful methods may not always be obvious. The bizarre natural forces of Mars will also tend to present obstacles.

Also, what may be helpful at one time, may be of no particular effect at another, and actually harmful at a third time. For instance, EATing in front of a Grimph is not recommended.

You may define the characteristics of your explorer by setting a value from 1 to 100% for each quality (such as strength, speed etc.), or you can let the computer automatically define your character for you.

During the game, each command may be one or two words (such as "LOOK","DROP ROCK","EAT FOOD","WAIT") or a single letter directional move command (N = North, S = South, E = East, and W = West).
boardgame.videogameversion: North American type-in BASIC program edition

boardgame.name: Between Light & Shadow: A Roll & Write Fantasy Game
boardgame.description:
Between Light & Shadow is the first in a series of roll & write exploration games where players develop their character from a shy village girl to a heroine.

In Between Light & Shadow you take on the role of a peasant girl from the village of Habrycg.
One day your father sends you away and your adventure begins.
You will get to know your world, meet other characters, come back from battles with rich loot.
The world and the shadow will present you with tasks.
You will need to use your health, gold, and food wisely to successfully overcome hazards and encounters.
Your goal is to learn more about your family and father's story.

Between Light & Shadow is a multi-chapter story adventure.
You can only be successful if you skillfully use your resources and health to acquire Dice manipulations.
You must use these dice manipulations judiciously in your fight against beasts of the shadow.
You have to plan and carry out movements in the world carefully and in an energy-saving manner.
Between Light & Shdow is not just a themed Roll & Write game.
Rather, it's a dice Manipulation puzzle and dice placement game.

boardgame.name: Sweet Existence: Pleasant Nonsense
boardgame.description: In the Pleasant Nonsense expansion pack for the Sweet Existence game, a few things have changed from the Sweet Existence game. Instead of Existence Squares, you’ll have Nonsense Squares that are dreams with unique powers. Perishing is no more. The Consciousness Persists Square is hiding in your Nonsense Squares and prevents you from dreaming so you can’t win. Action Squares multiply chances of mishaps, while Sucrose Sweet Disks make for a sweeter victory. Each game includes 1 of 3 possible mysterious object tokens to track the Active Being. The first being to pay for all 3 Nonsense Squares in front of them wins! It's a marvelous, light-strategy party game for current and budding Strange Planet fans ages 13 and up. —description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sweet Existence: A Strange Planet Card Game

boardgame.name: The Game of Gelato
Il Gioco del Gelato
boardgame.description:
The Game of Gelato, also known as 'Il gioco del Gelato', is a card game about gaining ingredients to prepare a quality ice cream: fresh cream, milk, beet sugar, seasonal fruit… Recipe book in hand, the winner is whoever manages to please customers by guessing their favorite flavors.

The box is made up of 110 cards, which are then divided into Customer cards, Ingredient cards and Base Ingredient cards; there is no shortage of recipes and regulations. The deck of customer cards, marked with an ice cream symbol, are to be placed in the center of the table and are revealed during construction to form the "shop". In turn, each player decides whether to prepare an ice cream to serve the customer or to obtain the necessary ingredients. To prepare the ice cream, the player must discard the necessary ingredients from his hand by first checking the recipe in the cookbook. The “wild” cards can replace any ingredient. The more ice cream of customers' favorite flavors the player prepares, the more victory points he earns.

The player with the most points when the deck runs out, wins.

boardgame.name: World of Warcraft Unshackled: An Escape Room Box
World of Warcraft: Entfesselt – Escape-Room Box
boardgame.description: Will you escape the dangers of Azeroth? You have 60 minutes to break free of the chains that bind and the evils that threaten the World of Warcraft®! Play as honorable members of the Horde and the Alliance and overcome obstacles before time runs out! Stop the spread of Professor Putricide’s plague of undeath in his bizarre laboratory, dodge devilsaurs in Un’Goro Crater, and restore order to Karazhan before the tower collapses! Featuring three different scenarios with three difficulty levels: easy, medium, and challenging. Will you be unshackled? Or will time seal your fate?

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Merchants Cove: The Entertainer Crossover Pack
boardgame.description:
Assume the role of a fantastical Bard on a journey for fame and glory. Enjoy a unique tempo-dial mechanism in your quest to be the best.

This character is a crossover character with the game Bardwood Grove, and can only be obtained by backing the Bardwood Grove Kickstarter campaign at any level that includes the Spirits of the Grove expansion.

boardgame.name: Tin Spin
boardgame.description:
Tin Spin is a mix of physical skill, luck, and a bit of strategy. You will split your turns either rolling your die or spinning it, trying to spin longer than your fellow players. It’s a game that comes in a mint tin, making it super compact and easy to bring places, though you will need a table with a hard surface to play on (no playing on carpet, grass, etc…).

The game has 25 gold cubes. The first player to earn 5 of them wins.

You earn cubes using the seven unique dice. Six can go to players (it supports 2-6 players) and the seventh is used to swap dice after each player's turn. It’s rare that you’ll have the same die every turn.

Each die has its strengths and weaknesses, and physical skill at dice spinning makes a difference. It’s surprising how easy it is to learn how to spin dice though. Some dice are more likely to earn you a cube when rolled, some are better at spinning, and you choose each turn to roll or spin. Either way you end your turn by rolling the swap die and doing what it says to swap dice with other players.

boardgame.name: Sichere Six
boardgame.description:
Sichere Six is the second entry in the "Nein Nine" series of trick-taking card games, and it introduces Fate's Mercy and Mirth. Players have the opportunity to stick their opponents with the painful penalty cards. If they feel brave, they can try to collect all of the penalty cards and bring down their opponents' scores even more. Sichere Six begins as a free-for-all. As the game progresses, temporary partnerships will form, backstabbery will ensue, and only one will escape Fate's game with the victory.

Over the course of no more than nine rounds, players will be trying to collect as many tricks as possible while avoiding dirty tricks that contain 9's.

During each round, the player who first collects a 9 becomes The Chosen and is granted Fate's Mercy. They get to exchange one card with the kitty. If they are feeling brave enough, they can try to collect all of the 9's and trigger the special scoring known as Fate's Mirth.

The first player to earn 9 points wins the game. If the game does reach the final round, the player with the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Adorablins
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Adorablins is a super cute and easy-to-learn storytelling game where you play as little Goblin-like creatures going on adventures in an endless variety of places. Everything you need to play is in a portable mint tin box that fits right in your pocket!

boardgame.name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Gettysburg (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
A new edition of the first Last Full Measure title; Gettysburg with a larger map in size and area covered; new map art and colors; new charts and tables; and new counters.

The Last Full Measure Series is a collection of brigade-level wargames covering battles of the American Civil War. The games use regiments to represent the brigades on the map, and allow them to occupy multiple hexes. LFM is an intermediate rules set that includes cavalry charges, ranged artillery fire, and a simple command system, at a scale 250 yards per hex and 100 men per strength point.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Gettysburg
